scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This copy of a Thomas Jefferson letter, [January 8, 1825], to the physician Benjamin Waterhouse (1754-1846) is in an unknown hand. In the letter, Jefferson expresses his religious views: "I am anxious to see the doctrine of one god commenced in our State. But the population of my neighborhood is too slender, and is too much divided into other sects to maintain any one Preacher well. I must therefore be contented to be an Unitarian by myself, altho I know there are many around me who would become so if once they could hear the question fairly stated."
Jefferson also responds to news about Mr. [John] Adams' afflictions by discussing his own dread of old age and infirmity.
